General Executive Summary for Chemical, Manufacturing and Oil Refining Facilities



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

The Dow Chemical, Allyn's Point Plant is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the site's comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at this facility.  It is the site's policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. However, if a release were to occur, employees are trained in emergency response to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  In addition, the emergency response plan is coordinated with Gales Ferry, CT Fire Department, which provides additional emergency response expertise.



The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:

The facility's primary activities encompass SB (Styrene Butadiene) Latex manufacturing.  There are 2 regulated substances present at the Allyn's Point facility.  These substances include 1,3-Butadiene, and Acrylonitrile  [2-Propenenitrile] for manufacturing liquid latex emulsion polymer. Previously the facility had a Magnum operating unit which used Acrylonitrile  [2-Propenenitrile] for the production of ABS (Acrylonitrile, Butadiene, Styrene) plastic. This facility was closed in 2008.



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:

The Allyn's Point facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with generally accepted good design practices and engineering standards.  Elements of the release prevention program that are in place include process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, tra

ining, mechanical integrity, management of change, pre-startup reviews, compliance audits, incident investigations, and employee participation.



Five-year Accident History

Styron LLC, Allyn's Point Plant has had an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years.  Due to stringent release prevention policies, the plant has not had any accidental releases as defined by the RMP rule of regulated substances during this period.



Emergency Response Plan

Styron LLC, Allyn's Point Plant has a written emergency response plan to respond to accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.



Ledyard LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There are no planned changes at this time. Styron LLC has performed a security vulnerability analysis. This study has increased the site's perimeter fencing and the number of cameras to improve the overall monitoring of the site's activities.
